benchmark_details.name: Region Comprehension Index (RCI)
benchmark_details.overview: RCI is the first model-based score to explicitly quantify a dataset's reliance on global versus local visual information in multimodal benchmarks, aiding researchers and practitioners in auditing and aligning benchmarks with real-world reasoning needs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a systematic evaluation framework for quantifying reasoning requirements in multimodal datasets and benchmarks.

data.source: Evaluated across 13 widely used multimodal benchmarks including AI2D, BLINK, and CHARTQA.

methodology.calculation: RCI is calculated as RCI_n = 1 - (Maximum Patch Performance (MPP_n) / Full Image Performance (FIP)).
methodology.interpretation: RCI values indicate the type of reasoning required: RCI > 0 indicates strong global reasoning needed; RCI < 0 indicates reliance on localized cues.
methodology.validation: RCI is validated when the Full Image Performance exceeds chance thresholds.
